javadoc:
Base type for integer data types such as {@link CharDataType chars}, {@link IntegerDataType ints}, and {@link LongDataType longs}.

If {@link FormatSettingsDefinition#getFormat(Settings)} indicates that this is a {@link FormatSettingsDefinition#CHAR CHAR} type, the {@link ArrayStringable} methods will treat an array of this data type as a string.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: name
params.comment: a unique signed/unsigned data-type name (also used as the mnemonic)

params.name: signed
params.comment: true if signed, false if unsigned

params.name: dtm
params.comment: data-type manager whose data organization should be used

methods.name: getFormatSettingsDefinition
methods.comment:
Return the Format settings definition included in the settings
 definition array

return.comment:
Format settings definition included in the settings
 definition array

methods.javadoc: @return true if this is a signed integer data-type
methods.name: isSigned

return.comment: true if this is a signed integer data-type

methods.javadoc:
@return the Assembly style data-type declaration
 for this data-type.
methods.name: getAssemblyMnemonic

return.comment:
the Assembly style data-type declaration
 for this data-type.

methods.name: getCMnemonic

return.comment:
the C style data-type mnemonic
 for this data-type.
 NOTE: currently the same as getCDeclaration().

methods.name: getCDeclaration

return.comment:
the C style data-type declaration
 for this data-type.  Null is returned if
 no appropriate declaration exists.

methods.name: getRepresentation
methods.comment: Get integer representation of the big-endian value.

params.name: bigInt
params.comment: BigInteger value with the appropriate sign

params.name: bitLength
params.comment: number of value bits to be used from bigInt

methods.name: getOppositeSignednessDataType

return.comment:
the data-type with the opposite signedness from
 this data-type.  For example, this method on IntegerDataType will
 return an instance of UnsignedIntegerDataType.

methods.javadoc: An "map" of the first 8 (by size) signed integer data types, where the element at index i points to the datatype of size i+1, with additional types with no size restriction appended after the first 8. @return array of all signed integer types (char and bool types excluded)
methods.name: getSignedTypes
methods.comment:
An "map" of the first 8 (by size) signed integer data types, where
 the element at index i points to the datatype of size i+1,
 with additional types with no size restriction appended after the first 8.

return.comment: array of all signed integer types (char and bool types excluded)

methods.javadoc: An "map" of the first 8 (by size) unsigned integer data types, where the element at index i points to the datatype of size i+1, with additional types with no size restriction appended after the first 8. @return array of all unsigned integer types (char and bool types excluded)
methods.name: getUnsignedTypes
methods.comment:
An "map" of the first 8 (by size) unsigned integer data types, where
 the element at index i points to the datatype of size i+1,
 with additional types with no size restriction appended after the first 8.

return.comment: array of all unsigned integer types (char and bool types excluded)

methods.name: getSignedDataType
methods.comment: Get a Signed Integer data-type instance of the requested size

params.name: size
params.comment:
data type size, sizes greater than 8 (and other than 16)
 will cause an SignedByteDataType[size] (i.e., Array) to be returned.

params.name: dtm
params.comment:
optional program data-type manager, if specified
 a generic data-type will be returned if possible.

methods.name: getSignedDataTypes
methods.comment: Returns all built-in signed integer data-types.

params.name: dtm
params.comment:
optional program data-type manager, if specified
 generic data-types will be returned in place of fixed-sized data-types.

return.comment: array of all signed integer types (char and bool types excluded)

methods.name: getUnsignedDataType
methods.comment: Get a Unsigned Integer data-type instance of the requested size

params.name: size
params.comment:
data type size, sizes greater than 8 (and other than 16)
 will cause an undefined type to be returned.

params.name: dtm
params.comment:
optional program data-type manager, if specified
 a generic data-type will be returned if possible.

methods.name: getUnsignedDataTypes
methods.comment: Returns all built-in unsigned integer data-types

params.name: dtm
params.comment:
optional program data-type manager, if specified
 generic data-types will be returned in place of fixed-sized data-types.

return.comment: array of all unsigned integer types (char and bool types excluded)

name: AbstractIntegerDataType
comment:
Base type for integer data types such as CharDataType, IntegerDataType,
 and LongDataType.
 
 If FormatSettingsDefinition#getFormat(Settings) indicates that this is a
 FormatSettingsDefinition#CHAR type, the ArrayStringable methods will
 treat an array of this data type as a string.
